elements.name: panel2
elements.title: Compare the UK's migration policy with ours by ticking all the statements that are correct. Correct any incorrect statements briefly and succinctly.

elements.name: Frage 2
elements.title: In the UK, the government can decide which migrants should enter the country. In Switzerland, this is not possible due to the bilateral agreements.

elements.name: Frage 3
elements.title: The British points system is similar to the Swiss migration policy, which applies to migrants from non-EU/EFTA countries.

elements.name: Korrektur 3
elements.title: Correction:
elements.correctAnswer: According to the British points system, only highly qualified and high-earning migrants from non-EU/EFTA countries are accepted.

elements.name: Frage 4
elements.title: The British points system is more transparent for migrants than the Swiss migration policy, which applies to migrants from non-EU/EFTA states.

elements.name: Frage 5
elements.title: The British points system applies both the means-tested and merit-based principles.

elements.name: Korrektur 5
elements.title: Correction:
elements.correctAnswer: The points system corresponds to the merit principle, but not to the means-tested principle.
